column1: #Text=The polycrystalline BiFeO3 samples were synthesized at\rthe University of Duisburg-Essen from a stoichiometric mixture\rof finely powdered bismuth oxide (Bi2O3, 99.9% Acros\rOrganics) and iron oxide (Fe2O3, 99.99% Alfa Aesar).
#Text=Following\ra calcination process for 3 hours at 820◦ C, the powder\rwas pressed to pellets and sintered for six hours under air\ratmosphere again at 820◦ C.

#Text=The samples were shipped to\rthe ISOLDE/CERN facility, where, to perform the PAC measurements,\rthe Cadmium isotope 111mCd was implanted at\rthe ISOLDE GLM beamline with an accelerator voltage of\r30 keV.
#Text=According to simulations with the SRIM software\rpackage [21], the implantation depth distribution shows a\rmaximum at around 116 Å.
#Text=The PAC measurements were\rdone immediately after implantation in the facilities of the\rISOLDE Solid State Physics Collaboration [13] using a fully\rdigital six detector spectrometer [22].
#Text=The furnace with an\rincluded sample holder allowed measurements at all desired\rtemperature points.
#Text=All measurements were performed at temperatures\rreached from below.
#Text=No PAC measurement was\rdone on cooling due to the time limits in the experiment.
#Text=PAC,\rbeing a hyperfine interaction technique, allows the investigation\rof the electromagnetic fields interacting with a nuclear\rprobe located in the material [23,24].
#Text=The probe nucleus in\rits excited state decays to its ground state via the sensitive\rintermediate state through a γ -γ cascade decay.

#Text=Through\ran angular correlation between the first and the second γ -\rray, distinguished through their energies and detection times,\rhyperfine interactions between the probe nuclei and their surrounding\ratomic structure can be monitored.
#Text=A fixed detector,\rwhich detects a first quantum γ1, defines a reference axis, conventionally designated as the z-axis.
#Text=A number of nuclei\rwith their initial spin Ii aligned to this direction is selected.
#Text=This nuclear alignment leads to an anisotropic radiation of\rγ2 with regard to γ1 [25].

#Text=If the probe nucleus quadrupole\rmomentum is disturbed through an electric field gradient\r(EFG) while being in the intermediate state, its spin I will\rexperience a torque which forces a spin-precession around\rthe before-referenced z-axis.
